DOC.brief_summary: Steel triple innominate osteotomy was designed for dysplastic hip in adolescents and young adults with three incisions to increase the coverage; however the amount of correction remained questionable due to ligamentous attachments that hinder the rotation. The investigators modified the technique with two anterior incisions and ramus cuts close to inferior acetabulum. The purpose of this study is to compare these two techniques in femoral head coverage
DOC.brief_title: Modified Triple Osteotomy for Acetabular Dysplasia
DOC.criteria: 1. Symptomatic acetabular dysplasia in adolescent or young adult 2. Closed triradiate cartilage 3. Minor coxarthrosis with Tonnis grades at 1 or 2 1. High subluxation or complete dislocation of the hip joint 2. Severe osteoarthrosis 3. Combined with proximal femoral osteotomy that changed the femoral neck shaft angle (such as varus or valgus osteotomy)
